abstract: Exchange sensitive information with a connected accessory.
overview:
## Overview

Use the Accessory Transport Extension framework to send sensitive information to accessories you’ve discovered and set up with [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/AccessorySetupKit]. You can use the [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/WiFiInfrastructure] framework if you need to share a WiFi network to the accessory.

You implement this functionality in an app extension that conforms to the [doc://com.apple.AccessoryTransportExtension/documentation/AccessoryTransportExtension/AccessoryTransportAppExtension] protocol. To add an accessory transport app extension, select your project from the Xcode project navigator, create a new target with File > New > Target, and choose the “Accessory Transport” template.

The framework calls your extension’s [doc://com.apple.AccessoryTransportExtension/documentation/AccessoryTransportExtension/AccessoryTransportAppExtension/accept(sessionRequest:)] method when the accessory is ready to begin a transport session. Implement this method to inspect the received [doc://com.apple.AccessoryTransportExtension/documentation/AccessoryTransportExtension/AccessoryTransportSession/Request] and then call [doc://com.apple.AccessoryTransportExtension/documentation/AccessoryTransportExtension/AccessoryTransportSession/Request/accept(_:)] or [doc://com.apple.AccessoryTransportExtension/documentation/AccessoryTransportExtension/AccessoryTransportSession/Request/reject(error:)] on the request.

After you accept a session from an accessory, your extension is responsible for directly connecting to the accessory and delivering data to it. The code included in the Accessory Transport template provides an event handler that creates an [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/AccessorySetupKit/ASAccessorySession] and responds to accessory activation by setting up a [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/WiFiInfrastructure/WINetworkSharingProvider] for the accessory. You can use this to send data to the accessory.

# AccessoryTransportExtension

**Framework**

Exchange sensitive information with a connected accessory.

## Overview

Use the Accessory Transport Extension framework to send sensitive information to accessories you’ve discovered and set up with [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/AccessorySetupKit]. You can use the [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/WiFiInfrastructure] framework if you need to share a WiFi network to the accessory.



You implement this functionality in an app extension that conforms to the [doc://com.apple.AccessoryTransportExtension/documentation/AccessoryTransportExtension/AccessoryTransportAppExtension] protocol. To add an accessory transport app extension, select your project from the Xcode project navigator, create a new target with File > New > Target, and choose the “Accessory Transport” template.

The framework calls your extension’s [doc://com.apple.AccessoryTransportExtension/documentation/AccessoryTransportExtension/AccessoryTransportAppExtension/accept(sessionRequest:)] method when the accessory is ready to begin a transport session. Implement this method to inspect the received [doc://com.apple.AccessoryTransportExtension/documentation/AccessoryTransportExtension/AccessoryTransportSession/Request] and then call [doc://com.apple.AccessoryTransportExtension/documentation/AccessoryTransportExtension/AccessoryTransportSession/Request/accept(_:)] or [doc://com.apple.AccessoryTransportExtension/documentation/AccessoryTransportExtension/AccessoryTransportSession/Request/reject(error:)] on the request.

After you accept a session from an accessory, your extension is responsible for directly connecting to the accessory and delivering data to it. The code included in the Accessory Transport template provides an event handler that creates an [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/AccessorySetupKit/ASAccessorySession] and responds to accessory activation by setting up a [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/WiFiInfrastructure/WINetworkSharingProvider] for the accessory. You can use this to send data to the accessory.



## App extensions

- **AccessoryTransportAppExtension**: A protocol that defines the behavior of the app extension and how it handles requests.
- **AccessoryTransportExtensionConfiguration**: An interface you use to configure and manage communication between the extension and the host process.

## Transport sessions

- **AccessoryTransportSession**: A class that manages a session between the extension and host process.
